alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 15 at 3:03AM EDT until October 15 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South central Penobscot County in east central Maine... * Until 600 AM EDT. * At 303 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain has fallen in the past hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Veazie, Kenduskeag, Indian Island, Glenburn, Orrington, Holden, Milford, Levant, Eddington, Hudson, Bradley, Greenbush, Bradford and Alton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
